Guide to the David Ludlow Thompson Papers

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Susan E. Burke

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-08-12T15:13-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The David Ludlow Thompson Papers consist primarily of letters Thompson sent to his mother, Keturah Sayre Thompson, and his friend, Elias A. Fairchild, relating his experiences in battle during the American Civil War, inquiring about friends and relations at home, and asking to be sent clothing, food, and reading materials. Housed with each letter is a transcript provided by the donor that has been photocopied onto archival quality paper. The reader is cautioned against editorial mistakes in the transcripts. The "original" transcripts (i.e. those not printed on archival quality paper) are housed in a binder in Box 2, along with a wooden spoon carved by Thompson while he was held as a prisoner of war. Portions of this collection relating to the Civil War have been digitized and are available to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via 
                <extref ns2:href="http://web.a.ebscohost.com/ehost/results?sid=100edece-435b-44c9-8d77-a6a870454678%40sessionmgr4003&vid=1&hid=4104&bquery=%28HJ+FBIY%29+OR+%28HJ+FBIZ%29&bdata=JmRiPWg1YyZ0eXBlPTEmc2l0ZT1laG9zdC1saXZl">EBSCOhost</extref>.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as the David Ludlow Thompson Papers, The New-York Historical Society.
David Ludlow Thompson was honorably discharged from military service on June 17, 1865 and died on March 31, 1926.

Portions of this collection relating to the Civil War have been digitized and are available to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via 
                <extref ns2:href="http://web.a.ebscohost.com/ehost/results?sid=100edece-435b-44c9-8d77-a6a870454678%40sessionmgr4003&vid=1&hid=4104&bquery=%28HJ+FBIY%29+OR+%28HJ+FBIZ%29&bdata=JmRiPWg1YyZ0eXBlPTEmc2l0ZT1laG9zdC1saXZl">EBSCOhost</extref>.

subject.value: United States.--Army.--Regiment Infantry, New York Volunteers, 3rd (1861-1865).

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence, 1779-1851 Scope and Contents note

This series contains correspondence between David Ludlow Thompson and his mother, Keturah Sayre Thompson. He writes primarily of the daily particulars of army life and asks often for news, clothing, and reading materials from home.

 Letter sent by David Ludlow (D.L.) Thompson to Keturah Sayre (K.S.) Thompson 1 1 January 5, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 2 February 2, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 3 February 10, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 4 March 7, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 5 March 29, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 6 April 15, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 7 August 20, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 8 1863 August Letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 11 October 11, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 12 December 21-25, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 13 December 28, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 14 January 3, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 15 January 6-17, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 16 February 19-23, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 17 March 3, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 18 June 6, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to K.S. Thompson 1 19 June 9, 1865 Series 2: Letters sent by David Ludlow Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild, 1862-1865 Scope and Contents note

Series 2 consists of letters sent by Thompson to his friend Elias Fairchild detailing the particulars of army life and asking for news from home. Most notably, this series contains a letter written from Libby Prison in October of 1862, detailing Thompson's experiences at the Battle of Antietam.

 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 20 1862 October Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 21 October 9, 1862 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 22 October 20, 1862 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 23 January 20, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 24 February 21, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 25 March 7, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 26 March 7, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 27 April 22, 1863 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 28 July 27, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 29 July 29, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 30 October 4, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 31 October 25, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 32 November 11, 1864 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 33 April 6, 1865 Letter sent by D.L. Thompson to Elias A. Fairchild 1 34 June 3, 1865 Series 3: Letters sent by David Ludlow Thompson addressed jointly to Keturah Sayre Thompson, Elias A. Fairchild, and other family members, 1863-1865 Scope and Contents note

Series 3 consists of letters addressed jointly to Keturah Sayre Thompson, Elias Fairchild, and occasionally other family members, including Thompson's sister. While Thompson again asks for news of home and describes the daily ritual of army life in these letters, he also describes his own bout with scurvy near the end of the war. Most notably, this series includes a letter written in August of 1863 from a military hospital in Portsmouth, Virginia describing his experiences there.

 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 35 March 19, 1863 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 36 April 28, 1863 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 37 June 7, 1863 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 47 March 22, 1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 48 May 24, 1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 49 May 7,1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 50 May 15, 1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 51 June 8, 1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 52 August 29, 1864 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 53 February 7, 1865 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 54 February 16, 1865 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 55 March 27, 1865 Joint letter sent by D.L. Thompson 1 56 April 26, 1865 Series 4: Other correspondence pertaining to David Ludlow Thompson, 1862-1865 Scope and Contents note

Series 4 consists of the discharge papers of David Ludlow Thompson, two pieces of correspondence sent to Thompson, a letter sent to Elias A. Fairchild declaring Thompson to be a prisoner of war, and the fragments of several letters written by Thompson.

 Discharge papers of David Ludlow Thompson 1 57 June 6, 1865 Letter sent to Elias Fairchild 1 58 October 10, 1862 Letter sent to D.L. Thompson 1 59 October 13, 1862 Letter sent to D.L. Thompson 1 60 July 28, 1865 Fragment of letter written by D.L. Thompson 1 61 September 1, 1862 Fragment of letter written by D.L. Thompson 1 62 November 21, 1863 Fragment of letter written by D.L. Thompson 1 63 June 17, 1864 Series 5: Biographical and Genealogical Materials, 1961, undated Scope and Contents note

Series 5 consists of biographical information about David Ludlow Thompson, including copies of articles he published about his experiences at Antietam and his obituary. This series also contains a 1961 letter from the U.S. Department of the Interior outlining his military record at the request of his grandson.

 Biographical Information 1 64 1961 Copies of articles written by David Ludlow Thompson 1 65 Undated Series 6: Wooden spoon carved by David Ludlow Thompson, 1862 Scope and Contents note

Series 6 consists of a wooden spoon that was carved by David Ludlow Thompson while he was held prisoner at Libby Prison in Richmond, Virginia after the Battle of Antietam.

 Wooden spoon carved by D.L. Thompson 2 1862
